classic.name: Atomic Bomb Dome
classic.description: Iconic remains of the Industrial Promotion Hall which was destroyed by the atomic bomb during WWII.

classic.name: Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum
classic.description: Popular museum documenting the WWII atomic-bomb blast in Hiroshima via exhibits, artifacts & talks.

classic.name: Peace Memorial Park - Hiroshima
classic.description: Memorial park dedicated to the victims of the atomic bomb & advocating for world peace since 1954.

classic.name: Hiroshima National Peace Memorial Hall for the Atomic Bomb Victims
classic.description: Memorial to atomic bomb victims, featuring memoirs, belongings & a hall for quiet reflection.

classic.name: Children's Peace Monument
classic.description: Memorial to children who died due to the 1945 atomic bombing, usually surrounded by paper cranes.

classic.name: MAZDA Museum
classic.description: Vehicles, assembly line & technology displays trace the evolution of the car maker since the 1920s.
classic.address: 3-1 Shinchi, Fuchu, Aki District, Hiroshima 735-0028, Japan

classic.name: Hiroshima Victims Memorial Cenotaph
classic.description: Simple monument designed in 1952, inscribed with the names of victims of the 1945 atomic bomb.
classic.address: Peace Memorial Park - Hiroshima, 1 Nakajimachō, Naka Ward, Hiroshima, 730-0811, Japan

classic.name: Shukkeien Garden
classic.description: Serene city garden dating to the 16th century, with a koi pond, a tea shop & flowering trees.

classic.name: Hiroshima Atomic Bomb Hypocenter Monument
classic.description: Historical Landmark - highly rated

classic.name: Hiroshima Museum of Art
classic.description: Museum showcasing European impressionist & modern Japanese art, plus a quiet courtyard.

classic.name: Hiroshima Castle
classic.description: Contemporary recreation of a destroyed 16th-century castle offering a history museum & city views.

classic.name: Okonomimura
classic.description: Sprawling food hall featuring multiple booths selling okonomiyaki savory pancakes.

classic.name: Flame of Peace
classic.description: Sculpture of 2 hands cupping a flame, honoring those killed by the atom bomb dropped in 1945.

classic.name: 5-Days Children's Cultural Science Museum
classic.description: Children’s museum showcasing interactive science exhibits, model trains & a planetarium.

classic.name: Hiroshima Prefectural Art Museum
classic.description: Founded in 1968, the museum offers exhibits by regional artists & a garden, plus a shop & eatery.

classic.name: Hiroshima Orizuru Tower
classic.description: Serene rooftop observation deck offering dramatic views of Hiroshima, plus a first-floor cafe.

classic.name: Numaji Transportation Museum
classic.description: Museum with model cars, trains & ships, a 2-floor futuristic city & "crazy bikes" for kids to ride.

classic.name: Hiroshima City Museum of Contemporary Art
classic.description: Sleek museum housing works by Japanese & international contemporary artists, plus a cafe & shop.

classic.name: HIROSHIMA GATE PARK
classic.description: Park

classic.name: Ebayama Museum of Meteorology
classic.description: Established in 1879, this meteorology museum features exhibits on weather & weather forecasting.
classic.address: Japan, 〒730-0835 Hiroshima, Naka Ward, Ebaminami, 1-chōme−40−１ 広島市江波山気象館
